title: Check if Input is Alphabetic
description:
ISC_ALPHA tests whether the character IN is an alphabetic character. If IN
is a sign A..Z, a..z or any umlaut, the function returns TRUE, if not the
function returns FALSE. In examining the Global Setup EXTENDED_ASCII
constant is considered. If EXTENDED_ASCII = TRUE the extended ASCII
character-set to be considered in accordance with ISO 8859-1. Umlauts
like Ä, Ö, Ü are considered only if the global constant EXTENDED_ASCII =
TRUE.
The following Table Explains the code:
Code EXTENDED_ASCII = TRUE EXTENDED_ASCII = FAS￾LE 0..64 FALSE FALSE
65..90 TRUE TRUE
91..96 FALSE FALSE
97..122 TRUE TRUE
123..191 FALSE FALSE
192..214 TRUE FALSE
215 FALSE FALSE
216..246 TRUE FALSE
247 FALSE FALSE
248..255 TRUE FALSE
name: ISC_ALPHA

input.name: IN
input.description: The input byte to be checked to see if it represents an alphabet character.

output.name: ISC_ALPHA
output.description: Returns true if the input byte is an alphabet character, otherwise returns false.

return_value.description: The boolean result indicating if the input is an alphabetic character.
